definition: simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)

sentences.english: Students are also required to assess their project in a final oral presentation.
sentences.chinese: 学生也需以期终口头简报方式来评估其专题。

sentences.english: Mr Kelly starts every morning with a counter-terrorism briefing.
sentences.chinese: 凯丽先生每个早晨都要参加一场反恐简报会。

sentences.english: Given that he's more prepared than I am, I suggest that he do the presentation.
sentences.chinese: 既然他比我准备更充份，我建议由他去做简报。

sentences.english: Includes six supplements, monthly newsletters , and two bulletins per year.
sentences.chinese: 每年含六次补编，每月简报和两份公报。

sentences.english: You can target a much wider audience via written reports and briefing papers.
sentences.chinese: 您能够通过书面报告和简报获得更广泛的观众。

sentences.english: Yes, I know most of the word processing. presentation, spreadsheet program.
sentences.chinese: 我知道大部分文字处理，简报，试算表程序。

sentences.english: To improve the students' speech delivery with the practices in class.
sentences.chinese: 透过课堂练习强化学生们上场演说与简报的表达方式。

sentences.english: Why does the Asst. Manager need to conduct the briefing?
sentences.chinese: 为什么大堂副理须做每日简报？

sentences.english: The presentation was a success and well received by our customers and partners.
sentences.chinese: 简报很成功，清楚的传达给了我们的客户和合作伙伴。

sentences.english: Slides are the images of your presentation.
sentences.chinese: 幻灯片是你所创建简报的再现。

sentences.english: Oral presentation can be made in English for the second semester.
sentences.chinese: 于第二学期简报之口语口头陈述部份须以英文进行。

sentences.english: It occurs to me that they forgot to mention a major marketing point in our presentation.
sentences.chinese: 结果我发现他们忘了在简报中提到一个重要的营销点。

sentences.english: You are required to prepare a written one-page statement for each project.
sentences.chinese: 每个专题要求准备一页的书面简报。

sentences.english: The special presentation that Tom was working on consumed all his spare time.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆做的这个特别的简报耗去了他所有的空闲时间。

sentences.english: Sam gave a presentation to the company's executives.
sentences.chinese: 山姆为公司高阶主管作简报。

sentences.english: Publications such as magazines and newsletters almost always require a grid.
sentences.chinese: 杂志和简报之类的出版物几乎都离不开栅格。

definition: to inform/to report/to make known/report/speech/talk/lecture/CL:篇[pian1],份[fen4],個|个[ge4],通[tong4]
to report/to give an account of/report
to report/to give an account of/to collect information and report back
to call a conference/to convene a meeting
